THE_DT strength_NN of_IN the_DT native_JJ police_NN force_NN is_VBZ 3,015_CD ._.
The_DT following_JJ figures_NNS exhibit_VBP the_DT admissions_NNS ,_, discharges_NNS ,_, and_CC deaths:60_JJ REPORT_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP CALCUTTA_NNP MEDICAL_NNP INSTITUTIONS_NNP ._.
The_DT force_NN is_VBZ numerically_RB equal_JJ to_TO four_CD regiments_NNS of_IN native_JJ infantry_NN of_IN H._NNP M_NNP 's_POS Indian_JJ Army_NNP ,_, to_TO which_WDT it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN likened_VBN ,_, but_CC without_IN sufficient_JJ reason_NN ,_, inasmuch_RB as_IN the_DT sepoy_NN is_VBZ under_IN strict_JJ military_JJ discipline_NN ,_, and_CC can_MD be_VB severely_RB dealt_JJ with_IN for_IN breaking_VBG any_DT of_IN the_DT hospital_NN rules_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN receiving_NN or_CC bringing_NN in_IN objectionable_JJ edibles_NNS ,_, smoking_VBG in_IN the_DT wards_NNS ,_, *_'' or_CC defiling_VBG the_DT premises_NNS ;_: whereas_IN the_DT police_NN surgeon_NN has_VBZ no_DT such_JJ powers_NNS ,_, or_CC a_DT conjee-house_JJ under_IN a_DT guard_NN at_IN his_PRP$ disposal_NN to_TO place_VB refractory_JJ patients_NNS ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ necessary_JJ for_IN the_DT efficient_JJ discipline_NN of_IN such_JJ an_DT hospital_NN ,_, as_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN the_DT police_NN chowkedars_NNS are_VBP of_IN the_DT sepoy_NN caste_NN ,_, and_CC many_JJ of_IN them_PRP have_VBP been_VBN sepoys_NNS ._.
The_DT police_NN force_NN has_VBZ ordinarily_RB more_RBR trying_VBG duties_NNS to_TO perform_VB than_IN the_DT sepoy_NN ;_: their_PRP$ daily_JJ average_NN of_IN duty_NN being_VBG from_IN 8_CD to_TO 10_CD hours_NNS ,_, and_CC they_PRP are_VBP exposed_VBN to_TO all_PDT the_DT changes_NNS of_IN climate_NN and_CC season_NN ,_, which_WDT accounts_VBZ for_IN the_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN recruits_NNS annually_RB required_VBN to_TO replace_VB those_DT who_WP have_VBP resigned_VBN ._.

Management_NN ._.
Although_IN the_DT weather_NN was_VBD hot_JJ and_CC trying_VBG during_IN a_DT greater_JJR portion_NN of_IN the_DT last_JJ year_NN ,_, owing_VBG to_TO the_DT insufficient_NN rains_VBZ ,_, yet_RB the_DT past_JJ year_NN was_VBD comparatively_RB healthier_JJR than_IN any_DT previous_JJ ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT epidemic_JJ cholera_NN ,_, neither_CC any_DT bad_JJ types_NNS of_IN fever_NN ._.

Statistics_NNS of_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
The_DT daily_JJ average_JJ number_NN of_IN sick_JJ treated_VBN during_IN the_DT year_NN was_VBD 35.652_CD ._.
A_DT larger_JJR number_NN of_IN patients_NNS would_MD have_VB been_VBN treated_VBN had_VBD there_EX been_VBN sufficient_JJ accommodation_NN for_IN them_PRP ._.
The_DT shed_VBN can_MD comfortably_RB accommodate_VB 36_CD beds_NNS ;_: but_CC from_IN June_NNP to_TO December_NNP ,_, when_WRB the_DT season_NN was_VBD unhealthy_JJ ,_, at_IN times_NNS 45_CD patients_NNS were_VBD treated_VBN in_IN the_DT hospital_NN ,_, and_CC accommodation_NN was_VBD provided_VBN for_IN them_PRP by_IN extra_JJ beds_NNS ._.
For_IN fear_NN of_IN overcrowding_VBG I_PRP was_VBD compelled_VBN to_TO send_VB away_RB patients_NNS to_TO other_JJ hospitals_NNS ._.
The_DT percentage_NN of_IN deaths_NNS to_TO the_DT number_NN treated_VBN during_IN the_DT last_JJ year_NN was_VBD 19_CD ,_, against_IN 26_CD in_IN the_DT previous_JJ year_NN ._.
This_DT includes_VBZ 29_CD moribund_NN cases_NNS which_WDT proved_VBD fatal_JJ within_IN 24_CD hours_NNS after_IN admission_NN ._.
Excluding_VBG these_DT ,_, the_DT death-rate_NN is_VBZ reduced_VBN to_TO 14_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT result_NN is_VBZ encouraging_JJ ;_: but_CC still_RB the_DT mortality_NN is_VBZ high_JJ ,_, and_CC is_VBZ attributable_JJ to_TO a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN low_JJ cases_NNS of_IN diarrh64_JJ REPORT_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP CALCUTTA_NNP MEDICAL_NNP INSTITUTIONS_NNP ._.
Out-door_JJ dispensary_NN ._.

This_DT death-rate_NN is_VBZ higher_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN 1873_CD ,_, which_WDT was_VBD 143_CD per_IN mille_NN ,_, and_CC is_VBZ considerably_RB higher_JJR than_IN the_DT death-rates_NNS of_IN 1872_CD and_CC 1871_CD ,_, in_IN both_DT of_IN which_WDT years_NNS it_PRP was_VBD 132_CD per_IN mille_NN :_: in_IN fact_NN this_DT is_VBZ the_DT highest_JJS death-rate_NN registered_VBD since_IN the_DT year_NN 1869_CD ._.

Dr._NNP S._NNP G._NNP Chuckerbutty_NNP died_VBD in_IN England_NNP on_IN the_DT 29th_CD September_NNP last_JJ ._.
He_PRP was_VBD for_IN many_JJ years_NNS 2nd_CD physician_NN in_IN the_DT Medical_NNP College_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, and_CC was_VBD well_RB known_VBN in_IN Calcutta_NNP as_IN an_DT able_JJ and_CC accomplished_JJ physician_NN ,_, and_CC an_DT excellent_JJ servant_NN of_IN Government_NNP ._.

all_DT his_PRP$ colleagues_NNS in_IN the_DT hospital_NN ._.

Typhoid_NNP fever_NN ._.
During_IN 1874_CD there_EX were_VBD 2,437_CD European_JJ patients_NNS treated_VBD ,_, with_IN an_DT average_JJ daily_JJ number_NN of_IN sick_NN of_IN 145.94_CD ,_, and_CC a_DT death-rate_NN of_IN 45.95_CD per_IN mille_NN ._.

The_DT death-rate_NN was_VBD less_JJR than_IN the_DT average_NN of_IN the_DT preceding_VBG nine_CD years_NNS ,_, and_CC Dr._NNP Ewart_NNP justly_RB remarks_NNS that_IN cholera_NN is_VBZ ,_, and_CC always_RB has_VBZ been_VBN ,_, throughout_IN the_DT past_JJ ten_NN years_NNS ,_, a_DT most_RBS disturbing_JJ element_NN in_IN the_DT mortuary_JJ returns_NNS of_IN the_DT hospital_NN ,_, and_CC has_VBZ given_VBN a_DT considerably_RB larger_JJR death-rate_NN than_IN any_DT other_JJ disease_NN during_IN the_DT same_JJ period_NN ._.

RESOLUTION_NNP (_( 2_CD )_) of_IN persons_NNS of_IN the_DT several_JJ races_NNS treated_VBN in_IN past_JJ years_NNS ,_, the_DT increase_NN appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN most_JJS marked_VBN among_IN the_DT Mahomedans_NNPS ;_: whilst_VB on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT slight_JJ falling_VBG off_RP in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN Europeans_NNPS and_CC Eurasians_NNPS treated_VBN ._.
4_CD ._.
As_IN regards_NNS the_DT nature_NN of_IN the_DT prevailing_NN diseases_NNS ,_, the_DT Lieutenant-Gover-_NNP nor_CC observes_VBZ that_IN the_DT most_RBS noteworthy_JJ point_NN is_VBZ stated_VBN to_TO have_VB been_VBN the_DT increase_NN as_IN compared_VBN with_IN the_DT past_JJ few_JJ years_NNS ,_, not_RB only_RB in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN cases_NNS of_IN cholera_NN treated_VBN ,_, but_CC in_IN the_DT intensity_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
The_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN cases_NNS admitted_VBN to_TO the_DT various_JJ hospitals_NNS was_VBD 666_CD ,_, against_IN an_DT average_NN of_IN 450_CD in_IN the_DT four_CD preceding_NN years_NNS ._.
In_IN 509_CD cases_NNS out_IN of_IN a_DT thousand_CD the_DT disease_NN resulted_VBD fatally_RB ,_, a_DT ratio_NN of_IN mortality_NN considerably_RB above_IN the_DT average_NN of_IN six_CD preceding_VBG years_NNS ,_, though_IN somewhat_RB less_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN 1873_CD ._.
As_IN in_IN 1873_CD ,_, the_DT number_NN of_IN cholera_NN cases_NNS in_IN the_DT 1st_CD and_CC 2nd_CD divisions_NNS of_IN the_DT town_NN were_VBD much_RB fewer_JJR than_IN in_IN the_DT other_JJ divisions_NNS ._.
The_DT records_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, are_VBP still_RB too_RB defective_JJ for_IN practical_JJ purposes_NNS ,_, as_IN the_DT localities_NNS in_IN which_WDT the_DT disease_NN was_VBD contracted_VBN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN 181_CD patients_NNS has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN reported_VBN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ only_RB as_IN regards_NNS in-door_JJ patients_NNS that_WDT details_NNS of_IN the_DT diseases_NNS treated_VBN are_VBP given_VBN ._.
As_IN com-_JJ pared_VBN with_IN the_DT previous_JJ year_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD an_DT increase_NN of_IN more_JJR than_IN 50_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN cases_NNS of_IN dysentery_NN ,_, and_CC of_IN more_JJR than_IN 60_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN cases_NNS of_IN remittent_NN fever_NN admitted_VBN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT decrease_NN of_IN more_JJR than_IN one-half_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN cases_NNS of_IN continued_JJ fever_NN ,_, and_CC of_IN phthisis_NN ,_, and_CC of_IN somewhat_RB less_RBR in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN cases_NNS of_IN typhoid_NN fever_NN admitted_VBN ._.
The_DT dengue_NN fever_NN has_VBZ almost_RB entirely_RB disappeared_VBN from_IN the_DT returns_NNS ._.
The_DT greatest_JJS number_NN of_IN deaths_NNS resulted_VBN from_IN dysentery_NN ,_, cholera_NN ,_, and_CC diarrh_NN (_( 3_CD )_) 2nd_CD Resident_NNP Surgeon_NNP should_MD be_VB made_VBN exclusively_RB available_JJ to_TO the_DT hospital_NN with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO promote_VB the_DT usefulness_NN of_IN this_DT branch_NN of_IN the_DT institution_NN ,_, but_CC he_PRP regrets_VBZ that_IN he_PRP can_MD hold_VB out_RP no_DT hope_NN of_IN the_DT concession_NN being_VBG made_VBN ._.

8_CD ._.
Calcutta_NNP Hospital_NNP Nurses_NNP '_POS Institution_NNP ._.
(_( 4_CD )_) Suburban_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, and_CC he_PRP trusts_VBZ that_IN a_DT liberal_JJ response_NN will_MD be_VB made_VBN to_TO the_DT appeal_NN about_IN to_TO be_VB made_VBN for_IN further_JJ aid_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO provide_VB out-offices_NNS for_IN the_DT new_JJ hospital_NN building_NN ,_, which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN completed_VBN ._.

2_CD ._.
I_PRP have_VBP again_RB on_IN this_DT occasion_NN to_TO express_VB my_PRP$ indebt-_JJ edness_NN to_TO the_DT Superintendent_NNP of_IN the_DT Mayo_NNP Hospital_NNP for_IN being_VBG good_JJ enough_RB to_TO supply_VB me_PRP with_IN a_DT copy_NN of_IN the_DT annual_JJ returns_NNS and_CC report_NN of_IN that_DT institution_NN and_CC of_IN its_PRP$ associated_JJ dispensaries_NNS ;_: to_TO the_DT Honorary_NNP Secretary_NNP for_IN having_VBG sent_VBN me_PRP a_DT copy_NN of_IN the_DT report_NN of_IN the_DT Calcutta_NNP Nurses_NNP '_POS Institution_NN for_IN 1875_CD ;_: and_CC to_TO the_DT Health_NNP Officer_NNP of_IN the_DT Calcutta_NNP Muni-_NNP cipality_NN for_IN having_VBG prepared_VBN for_IN me_PRP certain_JJ statistical_JJ returns_NNS in_IN connection_NN with_IN the_DT sickness_NN and_CC mortality_NN of_IN the_DT city_NN and_CC its_PRP$ suburbs_NN during_IN 1875_CD ._.
3_CD ._.
I_PRP have_VBP had_VBN summaries_NNS compiled_VBN of_IN the_DT very_RB complete_JJ and_CC interesting_JJ annual_JJ reports_NNS of_IN all_PDT the_DT Calcutta_NNP medical_JJ institutions_NNS submitted_VBN to_TO me_PRP by_IN the_DT medical_JJ officers_NNS individually_RB responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT management_NN of_IN each_DT ;_: and_CC from_IN these_DT compilations_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN from_IN the_DT remarks_NNS which_WDT I_PRP shall_MD offer_VB on_IN the_DT various_JJ figured_JJ statements_NNS in_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, I_PRP trust_VBP I_PRP may_MD be_VB able_JJ to_TO convey_VB a_DT clear_JJ and_CC concise_JJ idea_NN of_IN the_DT general_JJ working_NN of_IN the_DT Calcutta_NNP hospitals_NNS and_CC dispensaries_NNS ,_, and_CC of_IN the_DT vast_JJ amount_NN of_IN relief_NN they_PRP afforded_VBD to_TO all_DT who_WP sought_VBD their_PRP$ benefits_NNS ._.
Number_NNP of_IN institutions_NNS ._.
4_CD ._.
During_IN 1875_CD there_EX were_VBD thirteen_JJ institutions_NNS in_IN Calcutta_NNP and_CC its_PRP$ suburbs_NN ,_, exclusive_JJ of_IN the_DT lock_NN hospitals_NNS ,_, which_WDT afforded_VBD medical_JJ and_CC surgical_JJ relief_NN to_TO the_DT sick_JJ poor_JJ either_CC as_IN ``_`` in_IN door_NN ''_'' or_CC ``_`` out-door_JJ ''_'' patients_NNS ._.
Attendance_NN ._.
5_CD ._.
Statement_JJ No_NNP ._.
I_PRP exhibits_VBP the_DT number_NN of_IN persons_NNS who_WP were_VBD treated_VBN in_IN the_DT city_NN and_CC suburban_JJ hospitals_NNS and_CC dispensaries_NNS as_IN ``_`` in_IN ''_'' and_CC ``_`` out-door_JJ ''_'' patients_NNS during_IN 1875_CD ,_, and_CC in_IN it_PRP ,_, too_RB ,_, are_VBP given_VBN the_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT year_NN 1874_CD for_IN the_DT sake_NN of_IN easy_JJ comparison_NN :_: REPORT_NN ON_IN THE_NNP CALCUTTA_NNP MEDICAL_NNP INSTITUTIONS_NNP ._.
3_CD 6_CD ._.
From_IN this_DT table_NN we_PRP see_VBP that_IN there_EX has_VBZ been_VBN a_DT very_RB great_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN patients_NNS treated_VBN during_IN 1875_CD ,_, the_DT excess_JJ being_VBG 50,435_CD patients_NNS (_( 2,426_CD in-door_NN and_CC 48,009_CD out-door_NN )_) over_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN treated_VBN in_IN 1874_CD ._.
Great_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN patients_NNS ._.
7_CD ._.
This_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN patients_NNS treated_VBN was_VBD contributed_VBN to_TO by_IN all_PDT the_DT institutions_NNS with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN the_DT North_NNP Suburban_NNP Hospital_NNP and_CC the_DT Alipore_NNP Dispensary_NNP ,_, but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ principally_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT vastly_RB increased_JJ number_NN of_IN persons_NNS treated_VBN at_IN the_DT ``_`` in_IN ''_'' and_CC ``_`` out-door_JJ ''_'' departments_NNS of_IN the_DT Mayo_NNP Hospital_NNP and_CC its_PRP$ associated_JJ dispensaries_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN at_IN the_DT out_RP door_JJ departments_NNS of_IN the_DT Presidency_NNP and_CC Howrah_NNP General_NNP Hospitals_NNP ._.
Increase_NN at_IN all_DT institutions_NNS ,_, with_IN two_CD exceptions_NNS ._.
8_CD ._.
These_DT figures_NNS ,_, in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN any_DT epidemic_JJ disease_NN or_CC of_IN unusual_JJ sickness_NN ,_, are_VBP the_DT more_RBR satisfactory_JJ ,_, since_IN they_PRP demonstrate_VBP that_IN the_DT classes_NNS for_IN whose_WP$ benefit_NN these_DT hospitals_NNS and_CC dispensaries_NNS were_VBD opened_VBN are_VBP not_RB slow_JJ to_TO avail_VB themselves_PRP of_IN the_DT medical_JJ and_CC surgical_JJ advice_NN obtainable_NN at_IN them_PRP ._.
9_CD ._.
Statement_JJ No_NNP ._.

41_CD ._.
Having_VBG now_RB concluded_VBN my_PRP$ general_JJ observations_NNS on_IN the_DT working_NN of_IN the_DT Calcutta_NNP medical_JJ institutions_NNS during_IN 1875_CD ,_, and_CC shown_VBN the_DT great_JJ amount_NN of_IN relief_NN which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN afforded_VBN by_IN them_PRP to_TO the_DT sick_JJ poor_JJ of_IN Calcutta_NNP and_CC its_PRP$ suburbs_NN ,_, I_PRP can_MD not_RB close_VB this_DT part_NN of_IN my_PRP$ report_NN without_IN remarking_VBG that_IN I_PRP consider_VBP such_JJ satisfactory_JJ results_NNS are_VBP in_IN a_DT great_JJ measure_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT ability_NN ,_, zeal_NN ,_, and_CC humanity_NN displayed_VBN in_IN the_DT discharge_NN of_IN their_PRP$ duties_NNS by_IN the_DT medical_JJ staff_NN of_IN the_DT several_JJ institutions_NNS ;_: and_CC I_PRP venture_NN to_TO congratulate_VB His_PRP$ Honor_NNP the_DT Lieutenant-Governor_NNP of_IN Bengal_NNP upon_IN having_VBG such_JJ a_DT body_NN of_IN excellent_JJ officers_NNS to_TO carry_VB out_RP his_PRP$ benevolent_NN policy_NN towards_IN the_DT poor_JJ and_CC friendless_NN of_IN this_DT immense_JJ population_NN ._.

11_CD Statement_JJ No_NNP ._.
X.12_JJ REPORT_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP MEDICAL_NNP COLLEGE_NNP HOSPITAL_NNP ._.
THE_DT following_NN is_VBZ a_DT summary_NN of_IN the_DT very_RB comprehensive_JJ and_CC interesting_JJ annual_JJ report_NN submitted_VBN by_IN Dr._NNP Chevers_NNP on_IN the_DT working_NN of_IN the_DT Medical_NNP College_NNP Hospital_NNP during_IN the_DT year_NN 1875_CD ._.
Principal_JJ statistics_NNS of_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
1_CD ._.
The_DT accompanying_VBG table_JJ exhibits_NNS in_IN a_DT very_RB simple_JJ form_NN most_JJS of_IN the_DT principal_JJ statis-_JJ tical_JJ events_NNS of_IN the_DT hospital_NN during_IN the_DT past_JJ year_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP will_MD assist_VB in_IN illustrating_VBG various_JJ portions_NNS of_IN the_DT report_NN ,_, which_WDT ,_, in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN other_JJ and_CC more_RBR elaborate_JJ figured_JJ statements_NNS ,_, would_MD be_VB rather_RB confusing_JJ :_: CALCUTTA_NNP MEDICAL_NNP INSTITUTIONS_NNP ._.
13_CD 5_CD ._.
Of_IN the_DT 3,915_CD patients_NNS treated_VBD 1,673_CD were_VBD Christians_NNPS (_( Europeans_NNPS 768_CD ,_, Eurasians_NNPS 905_CD )_) ._.
Total_JJ number_NN treated_VBN and_CC mortality_NN of_IN Christian_JJ patients_NNS ._.
Ninety-nine_JJ Christians_NNP died_VBD ,_, or_CC at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 59.17_CD per_IN mile_NN ._.
This_DT rate_NN of_IN mortality_NN is_VBZ slightly_RB lower_JJR than_IN it_PRP was_VBD in_IN 1873_CD and_CC 1874_CD ._.
6_CD ._.
There_EX were_VBD 2,242_CD natives_NNS treated_VBD ,_, of_IN whom_WP 499_CD died_VBD ,_, or_CC at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 222.56_CD per_IN mille_NN of_IN total_JJ treated_VBN ._.
This_DT mortality_NN is_VBZ considerably_RB higher_JJR than_IN it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN in_IN any_DT of_IN the_DT five_CD preceding_NN years_NNS ._.
This_DT increase_NN of_IN mortality_NN is_VBZ ,_, in_IN Dr._NNP Chevers_NNP '_POS opinion_NN ,_, partly_RB attributable_JJ to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN during_IN eight_CD weeks_NNS in_IN the_DT very_RB unhealthy_JJ months_NNS of_IN August_NNP ,_, September_NNP ,_, and_CC October_NNP the_DT admission_NN to_TO the_DT Sealdah_NNP Hospital_NNP of_IN incurable_JJ applicants_NNS was_VBD forbidden_JJ ._.
Mortality_NN of_IN natives_NNS ._.
7_CD ._.
The_DT following_VBG table_NN shows_VBZ the_DT numbers_NNS treated_VBN ,_, the_DT deaths_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT rate_NN of_IN mortality_NN per_IN mille_NN of_IN total_JJ treated_VBN of_IN Christian_JJ patients_NNS from_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT more_RBR common_JJ diseases:14_JJ REPORT_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP Surgical_NNP operations_NNS ._.
11_CD ._.
At_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN 1874_CD there_EX were_VBD remaining_VBG in_IN hospital_JJ 26_CD patients_NNS who_WP had_VBD under-_JJ gone_VBN operations_NNS ,_, and_CC 110_CD important_JJ operations_NNS were_VBD performed_VBN during_IN 1875_CD ,_, giving_VBG a_DT total_NN of_IN 136_CD ;_: of_IN these_DT ,_, 83_CD recovered_VBD ,_, 2_CD were_VBD discharged_VBN relieved_VBN ,_, 3_CD were_VBD discharged_VBN unrelieved_JJ ,_, 31_CD died_VBD ,_, and_CC 17_CD remained_VBN under_IN treatment_NN at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
Death-rate_NN after_IN operations_NNS 12_CD ._.
The_DT death-rate_NN of_IN patients_NNS after_IN operation_NN ,_, whose_WP$ cases_NNS were_VBD treated_VBN to_TO a_DT termin-_JJ ation_NN ,_, was_VBD 260.50_CD per_IN mile_NN ._.
This_DT rate_NN is_VBZ higher_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN any_DT year_NN since_IN 1866_CD ,_, with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN 1873_CD ._.
Deaths_NNS from_IN hospitalism_NN ._.
13_CD ._.

15_CD 29_CD ._.

30_CD ._.
In_IN addition_NN to_TO the_DT in-patients_NNS ,_, 208_CD persons_NNS (_( either_CC parents_NNS or_CC relatives_NNS of_IN young_JJ children_NNS ,_, or_CC else_RB young_JJ children_NNS who_WP could_MD not_RB be_VB separated_VBN from_IN their_PRP$ sick_JJ parents_NNS ,_, )_) were_VBD dieted_VBN by_IN the_DT hospital_NN ._.

Remarks_NNS by_IN Deputy_NNP Surgeon-General_NNP ._.
PRESIDENCY_NNP GENERAL_NNP HOSPITAL_NNP ._.
DR._NNP EWART_NNP ,_, the_DT Surgeon_NNP Superintendent_NNP ,_, has_VBZ submitted_VBN a_DT very_RB full_JJ and_CC interesting_JJ report_NN on_IN the_DT working_NN of_IN this_DT institution_NN ,_, and_CC from_IN it_PRP the_DT following_VBG summary_NN has_VBZ been_VBN compiled_VBN 1_CD ._.
The_DT accompanying_VBG table_JJ conveys_NNS an_DT accurate_JJ idea_NN of_IN the_DT principal_JJ statistical_JJ events_NNS of_IN the_DT hospital_NN during_IN the_DT past_JJ year:16_NN REPORT_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP Total_NNP treated_VBD ,_, &_CC c._NN 2_CD ._.
During_IN 1875_CD there_EX were_VBD 2,905_CD Christian_JJ patients_NNS treated_VBD ,_, with_IN an_DT average_JJ daily_JJ number_NN of_IN sick_NN of_IN 161.68_CD ,_, and_CC a_DT death-rate_NN (_( inclusive_JJ of_IN all_DT cases_NNS of_IN mortality_NN )_) of_IN 58.17_CD per_IN mille_NN of_IN total_JJ treated_VBN ._.
The_DT total_JJ number_NN treated_VBN was_VBD considerably_RB in_IN excess_NN of_IN 1874_CD ,_, or_CC of_IN that_DT of_IN any_DT one_CD year_NN in_IN the_DT past_JJ decennial_JJ period_NN ,_, with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN 1872_CD ,_, when_WRB dengue_NN was_VBD prevalent_JJ ._.
Of_IN men_NNS ._.
3_CD ._.
The_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN male_JJ patients_NNS (_( Christian_NNP )_) was_VBD in_IN excess_NN of_IN that_DT of_IN any_DT year_NN of_IN the_DT past_JJ decennium_NN ,_, 1871_CD and_CC 1872_CD excepted_VBD ._.
Of_IN women_NNS ._.
Of_IN children_NNS ._.
4_CD ._.
The_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN women_NNS treated_VBN was_VBD considerably_RB in_IN excess_NN of_IN that_DT of_IN any_DT year_NN of_IN the_DT past_JJ decennium_NN ,_, with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN 1872_CD (_( the_DT dengue_NN year_NN )_) ,_, and_CC the_DT number_NN of_IN children_NNS treated_VBN was_VBD very_RB much_RB higher_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN any_DT year_NN of_IN the_DT same_JJ period_NN ._.
On_IN this_DT very_RB marked_JJ increase_NN of_IN in-door_JJ patients_NNS Dr._NNP Ewart_NNP thus_RB expresses_VBZ himself_PRP :_: CALCUTTA_NNP MEDICAL_NNP INSTITUTIONS_NNP ._.
17_CD 8_CD ._.
The_DT chief_JJ causes_NNS of_IN mortality_NN ,_, in_IN order_NN of_IN frequency_NN ,_, among_IN the_DT three_CD classes_NNS ,_, viz_NN ._.
men_NNS ,_, women_NNS ,_, and_CC children_NNS ,_, were_VBD as_IN follow:18_JJ REPORT_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP Hospital_NNP to_TO the_DT General_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, in_IN connection_NN with_IN my_PRP$ proposal_NN to_TO have_VB two_CD assistant_JJ surgeons_NNS appointed_VBN to_TO the_DT newly_RB opened_VBN out-door_JJ dispensary_NN ._. ''_''
Out-door_JJ patients_NNS ._.
18_CD ._.
The_DT out-door_JJ dispensary_JJ department_NN was_VBD opened_VBN in_IN 1874_CD ,_, when_WRB 1,107_CD patients_NNS received_VBN advice_NN and_CC medicine_NN ,_, but_CC during_IN the_DT past_JJ year_NN the_DT attendance_NN of_IN patients_NNS had_VBD increased_VBN to_TO 9,544_CD ._.
Dr._NNP Ewart_NNP reports_VBZ that_IN this_DT highly_RB satisfactory_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN out-door_JJ patients_NNS ``_`` is_VBZ not_RB the_DT measure_NN of_IN what_WP might_MD have_VB been_VBN done_VBN had_VBD the_DT arrangements_NNS for_IN the_DT carrying_VBG on_IN of_IN this_DT work_NN been_VBN of_IN a_DT more_RBR fixed_JJ and_CC permanent_JJ character_NN ._.
The_DT dispensary_NN has_VBZ been_VBN conducted_VBN by_IN doing-duty_NN assistant_NN surgeons_NNS under_IN the_DT supervision_NN of_IN the_DT 1st_CD and_CC 2nd_CD resident_JJ surgeons_NNS ._. ''_''
Dieting_VBG ._.
19_CD ._.
The_DT dieting_NN of_IN the_DT patients_NNS was_VBD well_RB and_CC satisfactorily_RB conducted_VBN ,_, and_CC without_IN any_DT complaints_NNS ._.
Improvements_NNS ,_, &_CC c._NN 20_CD ._.
Through_IN the_DT liberality_NN and_CC intervention_NN of_IN His_PRP$ Honor_NNP the_DT Lieutenant-Governor_NNP ,_, the_DT sanitary_JJ condition_NN of_IN the_DT hospital_NN has_VBZ been_VBN much_RB improved_VBN ._.
New_NNP furniture_NN and_CC a_DT substantial_JJ addition_NN to_TO the_DT hospital_NN equipment_NN has_VBZ been_VBN granted_VBN ._.
Improvements_NNS have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN in_IN the_DT bath-rooms_NNS ,_, lavatories_NNS ,_, and_CC latrines_NNS ._.
By_IN the_DT introduction_NN of_IN the_DT municipal_JJ system_NN of_IN drainage_NN ,_, the_DT hospital_NN has_VBZ been_VBN brought_VBN into_IN communication_NN with_IN the_DT neighbouring_VBG sewer_NN ._.
Sinks_NNS and_CC urinals_NNS have_VBP been_VBN trapped_VBN ,_, the_DT ground_NN to_TO the_DT west_NN of_IN the_DT hospital_NN has_VBZ been_VBN railed_VBN in_IN ,_, and_CC the_DT unsightly_RB and_CC jail-like_JJ wall_NN to_TO the_DT north_NN of_IN the_DT hospital_NN has_VBZ been_VBN removed_VBN ,_, and_CC the_DT other_JJ contemplated_JJ improvements_NNS ,_, when_WRB completed_VBN ,_, will_MD prove_VB of_IN the_DT highest_JJS sanitary_JJ value_NN by_IN enlarging_VBG the_DT compound_NN and_CC permitting_VBG the_DT freest_JJS circulation_NN of_IN air_NN in_IN all_DT directions_NNS ._.
Nursing_NN ._.
21_CD ._.
The_DT Lady_NNP Superintendent_NNP ,_, Miss_NNP Cartwright_NNP ,_, has_VBZ left_VBN for_IN England_NNP ,_, and_CC her_PRP$ place_NN has_VBZ been_VBN filled_VBN by_IN Miss_NNP Huband_NNP ._.
Dr._NNP Ewart_NNP reports_VBZ that_IN under_IN the_DT superintendence_NN of_IN this_DT lady_NN the_DT nursing_NN and_CC all_PDT that_DT appertains_VBZ to_TO it_PRP have_VB undergone_JJ great_JJ improvement_NN ._.
Medical_JJ subordinate_NN officers_NNS '_POS quarters_NNS ._.
22_CD ._.
These_DT quarters_NNS ,_, said_VBD to_TO be_VB condemned_VBN long_RB ago_RB ,_, are_VBP reported_VBN on_IN as_IN not_RB being_VBG fit_VBN for_IN habitation_NN ,_, and_CC Dr._NNP Ewart_NNP trusts_VBZ that_IN the_DT question_NN of_IN new_JJ quarters_NNS to_TO be_VB built_VBN on_IN the_DT site_NN of_IN the_DT village_NN to_TO the_DT east_NN of_IN the_DT hospital_NN will_MD be_VB considered_VBN and_CC sanctioned_VBN as_RB soon_RB as_IN possible_JJ ._.
At_IN the_DT suggestion_NN of_IN Mr._NNP Wade_NNP ,_, steward_NN of_IN the_DT hospital_NN ,_, a_DT reading-room_NN ,_, provided_VBN with_IN the_DT nucleus_NN of_IN a_DT medical_JJ library_NN and_CC with_IN the_DT lay_NN and_CC medical_JJ papers_NNS ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN established_VBN for_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN the_DT subordinate_NN medical_JJ officers_NNS ,_, by_IN whom_WP it_PRP is_VBZ very_RB much_JJ appreciated_VBN ._.
Hospital_NNP lirbary_NN ._.

Expenditure_NN ._.
26_CD ._.
The_DT expenditure_NN on_IN the_DT maintenance_NN and_CC administration_NN of_IN the_DT hospital_NN during_IN the_DT past_JJ year_NN amounted_VBD to_TO Rs_NNP ._.
1,14,772-15.6_JJ ._.
This_DT sum_NN is_VBZ exclusive_JJ of_IN the_DT amount_NN expended_VBD under_IN the_DT following_JJ heads_NNS ,_, and_CC to_TO the_DT cost_NN of_IN which_WDT the_DT Surgeon_NNP Superintendent_NNP had_VBD not_RB any_DT access_NN ,_, viz_NN ._.
1st_CD ,_, the_DT cost_NN of_IN repairs_NNS ,_, &_CC c._NN ,_, by_IN the_DT Department_NNP Public_NNP Works_NNP ;_: 2nd_CD ,_, of_IN medicines_NNS and_CC instruments_NNS supplied_VBN by_IN Medical_NNP Store_NNP Department_NNP ;_: 3rd_CD ,_, of_IN salaries_NNS ,_, &_CC c._NN ,_, of_IN nurses_NNS provided_VBN for_IN by_IN the_DT Nurses_NNP '_POS institution_NN ;_: and_CC 4th_CD ,_, of_IN the_DT salary_NN ,_, &_CC c._NN ,_, of_IN the_DT Lady_NNP Superintendent_NNP placed_VBD at_IN the_DT disposal_NN of_IN the_DT hospital_NN by_IN the_DT trustees_NNS of_IN the_DT Canning_NNP Home_NNP for_IN Nurses_NNP ._.

Conservancy_NN ._.
The_DT municipal_JJ authorities_NNS have_VBP bought_VBN two_CD new_JJ sites_NNS in_IN which_WDT to_TO bury_VB the_DT night-soil_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT question_NN of_IN burning_VBG instead_RB of_IN burying_VBG it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN under_IN discussion_NN ._.
The_DT main_JJ difficulty_NN in_IN the_DT disposal_NN of_IN the_DT night-soil_JJ seems_VBZ to_TO consist_VB in_IN its_PRP$ conveyance_NN through_IN the_DT streets_NNS to_TO the_DT place_NN for_IN its_PRP$ disposal_NN ,_, as_IN it_PRP is_VBZ found_VBN impossible_JJ to_TO get_VB the_DT work_NN done_VBN during_IN those_DT hours_NNS while_IN the_DT streets_NNS are_VBP empty_JJ ,_, and_CC ,_, owing_VBG to_TO the_DT carelessness_NN of_IN the_DT sweepers_NNS ,_, the_DT filth_NN carts_NNS ,_, though_RB well_RB constructed_VBN ,_, have_VBP frequently_RB been_VBN a_DT cause_NN of_IN most_JJS serious_JJ annoy-_JJ ance_NN to_TO people_NNS passing_VBG through_IN the_DT streets_NNS ._.
The_DT Magistrate_NNP is_VBZ of_IN opinion_NN that_IN this_DT state_NN of_IN affairs_NNS must_MD continue_VB until_IN a_DT night-soil_JJ cart_NN is_VBZ invented_VBN which_WDT shall_MD seal_VB itself_PRP without_IN the_DT necessity_NN of_IN any_DT special_JJ appliance_NN to_TO be_VB worked_VBN by_IN natives_NNS ._.
A_DT drainage_NN scheme_NN for_IN Howrah_NNP seems_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN under_IN consideration_NN ,_, but_CC owing_VBG to_TO the_DT direction_NN of_IN the_DT levels_NNS ,_, &_CC c._NN ,_, and_CC the_DT cost_NN of_IN carrying_VBG it_PRP out_RP in_IN its_PRP$ integrity_NN ,_, was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB far_RB beyond_IN the_DT resources_NNS of_IN the_DT municipal_JJ funds_NNS ._.
It_PRP seems_VBZ that_IN Howrah_NNP is_VBZ composed_VBN of_IN two_CD portions_NNS ,_, of_IN which_WDT the_DT circumstances_NNS ,_, as_IN regards_NNS the_DT question_NN of_IN drainage_NN ,_, are_VBP widely_RB different_JJ ._.
The_DT first_JJ of_IN these_DT portions_NNS ,_, that_IN which_WDT is_VBZ principally_RB inhabited_VBN by_IN Europeans_NNPS and_CC Eurasians_NNPS ,_, is_VBZ metropolitan_JJ in_IN character_NN ,_, and_CC comprises_VBZ an_DT area_NN of_IN two_CD miles_NNS or_CC under_IN ;_: the_DT other_JJ portion_NN is_VBZ entirely_RB rural_JJ ,_, consisting_VBG of_IN an_DT agglomeration_NN of_IN densely_RB packed_VBN native_JJ houses_NNS ,_, and_CC has_VBZ an_DT area_NN of_IN between_IN 10_CD and_CC 11_CD square_JJ miles_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ considered_VBN that_IN the_DT only_JJ way_NN of_IN dealing_VBG practically_RB with_IN the_DT drainage_NN of_IN Howrah_NNP is_VBZ to_TO treat_VB the_DT metropolitan_NN and_CC rural_JJ areas_NNS separately_RB ._.
For_IN the_DT former_JJ it_PRP is_VBZ proposed_VBN to_TO have_VB an_DT under-ground_JJ system_NN of_IN masonry_NN drains_NNS ,_, for_IN the_DT latter_JJR a_DT system_NN of_IN open_JJ grassed_VBN drains_NNS debouching_VBG upon_IN tanks_NNS ._.
The_DT masonry_NN drain_NN scheme_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ stated_VBN ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN carried_VBN out_IN to_TO a_DT small_JJ extent_NN ,_, but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ also_RB stated_VBN to_TO be_VB undeniable_JJ that_IN it_PRP has_VBZ done_VBN a_DT great_JJ deal_NN for_IN metropolitan_JJ Howrah_NNP ,_, and_CC ,_, in_IN the_DT opinion_NN of_IN the_DT Magistrate_NNP ,_, will_MD ,_, in_IN its_PRP$ completed_VBN state_NN ,_, do_VBP all_DT that_WDT is_VBZ claimed_VBN for_IN it_PRP ,_, and_CC effectually_RB relieve_VB Howrah_NNP of_IN the_DT rainfall_JJ water_NN ._.
15_CD ._.

READ_NNP (_( 2_CD )_) largest_JJS number_NN of_IN in-door_JJ patients_NNS was_VBD admitted_VBN during_IN the_DT months_NNS of_IN November_NNP ,_, October_NNP ,_, August_NNP ,_, September_NNP ,_, December_NNP ,_, and_CC July_NNP ._.
The_DT month_NN of_IN February_NNP is_VBZ shown_VBN to_TO have_VB been_VBN the_DT most_RBS healthy_JJ of_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
The_DT greatest_JJS mortality_NN occurred_VBD in_IN November_NNP ;_: and_CC the_DT lowest_JJS in_IN June_NNP ._.
The_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN deaths_NNS in_IN November_NNP is_VBZ exceptional_JJ ,_, and_CC is_VBZ attributed_VBN to_TO the_DT unusual_JJ prevalence_NN of_IN cholera_NN during_IN that_DT month_NN ,_, as_IN during_IN previous_JJ years_NNS the_DT largest_JJS proportion_NN ,_, or_CC 31.43_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT patients_NNS treated_VBN ,_, were_VBD suffering_VBG from_IN intermittent_NN and_CC remittent_NN fevers_NNS with_IN their_PRP$ sequelæ_NN ._.

FROM_IN THE_NNP SURGEON-GENERAL_NNP ,_, INDIAN_NNP MEDICAL_NNP DEPARTMENT_NNP ,_, To_TO THE_NNP SECRETARY_NNP TO_NNP THE_NNP GOVERNMENT_NNP OF_NNP BENGAL_NNP ,_, JUDICIAL_NNP DEPARTMENT_NNP ._.
Dated_VBN Fort_NNP William_NNP ,_, the_DT 14th_CD June_NNP 1877_CD ._.
Report_NNP compiled_VBD in_IN an_DT almost_RB similar_JJ form_NN with_IN those_DT of_IN preceding_VBG years_NNS ._.
SIR_NNP ,_, I_PRP HAVE_VBP the_DT honor_NN to_TO forward_VB my_PRP$ report_NN on_IN the_DT working_NN of_IN the_DT Calcutta_NNP medical_JJ institutions_NNS during_IN the_DT past_JJ year_NN ,_, for_IN submission_NN to_TO His_PRP$ Honor_NNP the_DT Lieutenant-Governor_NNP of_IN Bengal_NNP ._.
This_DT report_NN has_VBZ been_VBN compiled_VBN in_IN an_DT almost_RB similar_JJ form_NN with_IN those_DT of_IN preceding_VBG years_NNS ,_, because_IN I_PRP considered_VBD that_IN ,_, while_IN by_IN doing_VBG so_RB I_PRP could_MD convey_VB a_DT clear_JJ idea_NN of_IN the_DT working_NN of_IN the_DT institutions_NNS and_CC of_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN medical_JJ and_CC surgical_JJ aid_NN afforded_VBN to_TO the_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN in_IN and_CC out-door_JJ patients_NNS treated_VBN in_IN them_PRP ,_, I_PRP should_MD at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN add_VB another_DT number_NN to_TO the_DT useful_JJ series_NN of_IN these_DT annual_JJ pamphlets_NNS ,_, which_WDT will_MD always_RB be_VB available_JJ for_IN reference_NN ,_, and_CC which_WDT ,_, from_IN being_VBG drawn_VBN up_RP in_IN the_DT manner_NN just_RB stated_VBN ,_, will_MD conveniently_RB and_CC readily_RB assist_VB in_IN supplying_VBG whatever_WDT information_NN may_MD be_VB required_VBN regarding_VBG the_DT Calcutta_NNP hospitals_NNS at_IN any_DT future_JJ time_NN ._.
The_DT medical_JJ institutions_NNS reported_VBN on_IN ._.
1st_CD ,_, Medical_NNP College_NNP Hospital_NNP ;_: 2nd_CD ,_, Presidency_NNP General_NNP Hospital_NNP ;_: 3rd_CD ,_, Camp-_NNP bell_NNP Hospital_NNP ;_: 4th_CD ,_, Police_NNP Chowkeedar_NNP Hospital_NNP ;_: 5th_CD ,_, the_DT Mayo_NNP Hospital_NNP and_CC its_PRP$ associated_JJ dispensaries_NNS ;_: 6th_CD ,_, the_DT North_NNP Suburban_NNP Hospital_NNP ;_: 7th_CD ,_, the_DT Alipore_NNP Dis-_NNP pensary_NN ;_: 8th_CD ,_, the_DT Bhowanipore_NNP Dispen-_NNP sary_NN ;_: 9th_CD ,_, the_DT Arratoon_NNP Apcar_NNP Dispensary_NNP ;_: 10th_CD ,_, the_DT Calcutta_NNP Hospital_NNP Nurses_NNP '_POS Insti-_JJ tution_NN ;_: 11th_CD ,_, the_DT Howrah_NNP General_NNP Hospital_NNP ;_: and_CC 12th_CD ,_, the_DT Calcutta_NNP Lock-_NNP hospitals_NNS ._.
2_CD ._.
The_DT medical_JJ institutions_NNS which_WDT form_VBP the_DT subject_NN of_IN the_DT present_JJ report_NN are_VBP shown_VBN in_IN the_DT margin_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP will_MD be_VB observed_VBN that_IN they_PRP have_VBP remained_VBN unchanged_JJ during_IN the_DT year_NN under_IN review_NN ._.
I_PRP have_VBP again_RB included_VBN with_IN them_PRP the_DT Calcutta_NNP Lock-hospitals_NNP and_CC the_DT Calcutta_NNP Hospital_NNP Nurses_NNP '_POS Institution3_NNP REPORT_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP CALCUTTA_NNP MEDICAL_NNP INSTITUTIONS_NNP ._.
4_CD ._.
Before_IN making_VBG any_DT comment_NN on_IN the_DT preceding_VBG statement_NN ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB as_RB well_RB to_TO mention_VB that_IN the_DT figures_NNS given_VBN in_IN it_PRP under_IN the_DT headings_NNS ``_`` in-door_JJ ''_'' and_CC ``_`` out-door_JJ ''_'' represent_NN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN patients_NNS treated_VBN ,_, i.e_NN ._.
the_DT total_NN of_IN the_DT cases_NNS remaining_VBG from_IN the_DT preceding_VBG year_NN ,_, along_IN with_IN the_DT new_JJ admissions_NNS of_IN the_DT year_NN under_IN review_NN ;_: and_CC also_RB that_IN the_DT 4,352_CD in-door_JJ patients_NNS of_IN the_DT Medical_NNP College_NNP Hospital_NNP include_VBP 3,818_CD treated_VBN in_IN the_DT medical_JJ ,_, surgical_JJ ,_, and_CC midwifery_NN wards_NNS ,_, and_CC 534_CD in_IN the_DT eye_NN infirmary_NN ._.
The_DT latter_JJ number_NN (_( 534_CD )_) ,_, from_IN which_WDT no_DT death_NN was_VBD recorded_VBN ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN excluded_VBN from_IN the_DT calculation_NN of_IN the_DT death-rate_NN ._.

I_PRP can_MD not_RB believe_VB that_IN the_DT disease_NN has_VBZ of_IN late_JJ years_NNS assumed_VBD a_DT more_RBR virulent_JJ type_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN the_DT increased_VBN mortality_NN from_IN it_PRP may_MD be_VB thus_RB accounted_VBN for_IN ;_: on_IN the_DT contrary_JJ ,_, I_PRP consider_VBP that_IN the_DT hospital_JJ death-rate_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB accepted_VBN as_IN affording_VBG a_DT crucial_JJ proof_NN of_IN a_DT more_RBR fatal_JJ type_NN of_IN disease_NN ,_, but_CC rather_RB because_IN the_DT ratio_NN of_IN mortality_NN depends_VBZ much_RB on_IN the_DT width_NN of_IN the_DT area_NN of_IN attacks_NNS ._.

In_IN some_DT hospitals_NNS certain_JJ important_JJ sanitary_JJ improvements_NNS were_VBD made_VBN inside_IN the_DT buildings_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN in_IN the_DT grounds_NNS surrounding_VBG them_PRP ._.
I_PRP refrain_VBP from_IN making_VBG any_DT allusion_NN either_DT to_TO the_DT proposed_VBN erection_NN of_IN new_JJ buildings_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO the_DT alterations_NNS which_WDT have_VBP been_VBN proposed_VBN in_IN those_DT at_IN present_JJ in_IN occupation_NN ,_, as_IN I_PRP am_VBP of_IN opinion_NN that_IN in_IN every_DT case_NN ,_, more_JJR particularly_RB in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN hospitals_NNS where_WRB a_DT considerable_JJ sum_NN of_IN public_JJ money_NN is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO be_VB expended_VBN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ more_RBR satisfactory_JJ for_IN Government_NNP ,_, for_IN the_DT Medical_NNP Department_NNP ,_, and_CC for_IN all_DT concerned_VBN to_TO have_VB the_DT expediency_NN for_IN such_JJ alterations_NNS or_CC new_JJ buildings_NNS determined_VBN on_IN ,_, as_IN is_VBZ the_DT case_NN at_IN present_NN ,_, by_IN a_DT thoroughly_JJ competent_NN committee_NN ,_, rather_RB than_IN to_TO incur_VB expense_NN on_IN the_DT ipse_NN dixit_NN of_IN any_DT officer_NN ,_, even_RB though_IN his_PRP$ opinion_NN may_MD be_VB ever_RB so_RB reliable_JJ ._.
As_IN to_TO the_DT improvements_NNS which_WDT have_VBP been_VBN effected_VBN during_IN the_DT year_NN ,_, and_CC regarding_VBG others_NNS which_WDT were_VBD considered_VBN necessary_JJ ,_, I_PRP would_MD refer_VB to_TO paragraph_VB 26_CD of_IN the_DT report_NN of_IN the_DT Medical_NNP College_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, to_TO paragraphs_VB 12_CD ,_, 18_CD ,_, 20_CD ,_, and_CC 21_CD of_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT General_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, to_TO paragraphs_VB 14_CD ,_, 15_CD ,_, 16_CD ,_, 17_CD ,_, and_CC 18_CD of_IN the_DT Campbell_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, and_CC to_TO paragraph_VB 17_CD of_IN the_DT Howrah_NNP Hospital_NNP ._.
Buildings_NNS ._.
30_CD ._.
The_DT following_JJ changes_NNS took_VBD place_NN amongst_IN the_DT hospital_JJ staff_NN during_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
Dr._NNP Norman_NNP Chevers_NNP ,_, who_WP was_VBD Principal_NNP of_IN the_DT Medical_NNP College_NNP ,_, and_CC ex_FW officio_FW first_RB Physician_JJ to_TO the_DT Medical_NNP College_NNP Hospital_NNP since_IN the_DT 27th_CD April_NNP 1861_CD ,_, retired_VBN from_IN the_DT service_NN on_IN the_DT 31st_CD March_NNP ,_, having_VBG served_VBN Government_NNP ,_, both_DT faithfully_RB and_CC with_IN great_JJ ability_NN ,_, for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN nearly_RB 28_CD years_NNS ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB unnecessary_JJ to_TO review_VB the_DT eminent_NN services_NNS rendered_VBN by_IN Dr._NNP Chevers_NNP during_IN the_DT long_JJ period_NN he_PRP was_VBD Principal_NNP of_IN the_DT Medical_NNP College_NNP ,_, as_IN they_PRP are_VBP well_RB known_VBN to_TO Government_NNP ,_, and_CC were_VBD acknowledged_VBN by_IN His_PRP$ Honor_NNP the_DT Lieutenant-Governor_NNP in_IN the_DT resolution_NN on_IN my_PRP$ report_NN of_IN these_DT institutions_NNS for_IN 1875_CD ._.
I_PRP may_MD ,_, however_RB ,_, remark_NN that_IN ,_, in_IN publishing_VBG his_PRP$ able_JJ paper_NN on_IN the_DT health_NN of_IN the_DT European_JJ soldiers_NNS in_IN India_NNP ,_, he_PRP set_VBD the_DT machinery_NN in_IN motion_NN by_IN which_WDT the_DT necessity_NN for_IN a_DT more_RBR extended_JJ knowledge_NN of_IN hygiene_NN became_VBD so_RB apparent_JJ ,_, and_CC by_IN means_NNS of_IN which_WDT the_DT condition_NN of_IN the_DT British_JJ soldiers_NNS serving_VBG in_IN India_NNP ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN of_IN their_PRP$ families_NNS ,_, has_VBZ of_IN late_JJ years_NNS become_VBP so_RB materially_RB improved_VBN ._.
With_IN Changes_NNP amongst_VBP the_DT hospital_JJ staff_NN ._.
12_CD REPORT_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP mature_NN experience_NN as_IN a_DT medical_JJ jurist_NN ,_, he_PRP compiled_VBD his_PRP$ work_NN on_IN Medical_JJ Jurisprudence_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ considered_VBN by_IN all_DT judicial_JJ and_CC medical_JJ officers_NNS in_IN India_NNP to_TO be_VB a_DT reliable_JJ authority_NN in_IN cases_NNS of_IN difficulty_NN ,_, as_IN it_PRP contains_VBZ information_NN of_IN a_DT special_JJ kind_NN in_IN relation_NN to_TO this_DT country_NN which_WDT can_MD not_RB be_VB obtained_VBN elsewhere_RB ._.
Dr._NNP Chevers_NNP ,_, by_IN his_PRP$ uniformly_JJ courteous_JJ ,_, attractive_JJ ,_, and_CC genial_JJ manners_NNS ,_, had_VBD formed_VBN a_DT large_JJ circle_NN of_IN friends_NNS ,_, both_DT European_NNP and_CC Native_NNP ,_, in_IN Calcutta_NNP ,_, who_WP ,_, while_IN regretting_VBG his_PRP$ departure_NN from_IN amongst_VBG them_PRP ,_, still_RB wish_VB him_PRP the_DT full_JJ enjoyment_NN of_IN many_JJ happy_JJ years_NNS of_IN his_PRP$ well-earned_JJ repose_NN at_IN home_NN ,_, where_WRB no_DT doubt_NN he_PRP will_MD be_VB found_VBN foremost_RB in_IN the_DT ranks_NNS of_IN the_DT profession_NN whose_WP$ honor_NN and_CC interests_NNS he_PRP held_VBD so_RB dear_JJ ._.
Surgeon-Major_JJ S._NNP B._NNP Partridge_NNP ,_, Professor_NNP of_IN Surgery_NNP in_IN the_DT Medical_NNP College_NNP and_CC ex_FW officio_FW first_RB Surgeon_NNP in_IN the_DT Medical_NNP College_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, and_CC Surgeon-Major_NNP J._NNP Ewart_NNP ,_, M.D._NNP ,_, Superintend-_NNP ent_NN of_IN the_DT Presidency_NNP General_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, left_VBD Calcutta_NNP on_IN furlough_NN to_TO England_NNP with_IN Dr._NNP Chevers_NNP ,_, and_CC were_VBD succeeded_VBN by_IN Surgeons-Major_NNP E._NNP J._NNP Gayer_NNP and_CC J._NNP Elliot_NNP ,_, M.D._NNP ,_, respectively_RB ._.

31_CD ._.
In_IN conclusion_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ clear_JJ that_IN the_DT working_NN of_IN the_DT Calcutta_NNP medical_JJ institutions_NNS during_IN the_DT year_NN 1876_CD has_VBZ been_VBN eminently_RB successful_JJ ,_, and_CC that_IN the_DT satisfactory_JJ result_NN has_VBZ been_VBN obtained_VBN chiefly_NN through_IN the_DT diligence_NN ,_, zeal_NN ,_, and_CC ability_NN with_IN which_WDT the_DT medical_JJ officers_NNS con-_NNS cerned_VBN have_VBP performed_VBN their_PRP$ responsible_JJ (_( in_IN some_DT cases_NNS very_RB onerous_JJ )_) duties_NNS ._.

of_IN cases_NNS operated_VBN on_IN ._.

(_( against_IN 6.44_CD ,_, 7.17_CD ,_, 7.31_CD ,_, 6.58_CD ,_, 8.05._CD and_CC 7.49_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.

Hospital_NN building_NN ._.
15_CD ._.
In_IN regard_NN to_TO the_DT hospital_NN building_NN ,_, Dr._NNP Woodford_NNP reports_VBZ as_IN follows_VBZ on_IN what_WP he_PRP considers_VBZ to_TO be_VB existing_VBG defects_NNS in_IN it:26_JJ REPORT_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP The_DT buildings_NNS are_VBP in_IN good_JJ order_NN ,_, except_IN that_IN the_DT roof_NN of_IN the_DT main_JJ building_NN leaks_VBZ a_DT good_JJ deal_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN consequence_NN the_DT patients_NNS are_VBP often_RB put_VBN to_TO great_JJ discomfort_NN ._.
To_TO remedy_VB this_DT ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN to_TO render_VB the_DT building_NN cooler_NN during_IN the_DT hot_JJ season_NN ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN proposed_VBN to_TO put_VB an_DT inner_JJ wooden_JJ roof_NN beneath_IN the_DT corrugated_JJ iron_NN one_CD ,_, and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ ,_, no_DT doubt_NN ,_, very_RB desirable_JJ that_IN this_DT should_MD be_VB carried_VBN out_RP ._.

It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB very_RB desirable_JJ that_IN gas_NN should_MD be_VB laid_VBN on_IN for_IN lighting_VBG the_DT extensive_JJ compound_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN for_IN use_NN in_IN the_DT wards_NNS ._.
Dr._NNP Woodford_NNP very_RB justly_RB complains_VBZ of_IN the_DT annoyance_NN that_WDT exists_VBZ in_IN the_DT inhabitants_NNS of_IN a_DT village_NN close_RB to_TO the_DT south_NN wall_NN having_VBG the_DT right_NN of_IN way_NN through_IN the_DT compound_NN ;_: and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ greatly_RB to_TO be_VB hoped_VBN that_IN measures_NNS will_MD be_VB taken_VBN to_TO stop_VB the_DT nuisance_NN ,_, for_IN as_RB long_RB as_IN it_PRP exists_VBZ the_DT authorities_NNS of_IN the_DT hospital_NN can_MD have_VB no_DT proper_JJ command_NN over_IN their_PRP$ own_JJ premises_NNS ._. ''_''

POLICE_NNP CHOWKEEDAR_NNP HOSPITAL_NNP ._.
DR._NNP WOODFORD_NNP prefaces_VBZ his_PRP$ report_NN of_IN the_DT Police_NNP Chowkeedar_NNP Hospital_NNP for_IN 1876_CD ,_, of_IN which_WDT the_DT following_NN is_VBZ a_DT brief_JJ summary_JJ ,_, with_IN this_DT remark_NN ,_, viz.27_FW CALCUTTA_NNP MEDICAL_NNP INSTITUTIONS_NNP System_NNP of_IN under-feeding_JJ ._.
services_NNS would_MD be_VB a_DT tedious_JJ and_CC difficult_JJ task_NN ,_, as_IN the_DT men_NNS of_IN the_DT native_JJ army_NN garrison_NN stations_NNS situated_VBN in_IN Bengal_NNP ,_, the_DT North-Western_JJ Provinces_NNS ,_, Oudh_NNP ,_, the_DT Punjab_NNP ,_, and_CC in_IN Central_NNP India_NNP ._.
Some_DT of_IN the_DT regiments_NNS are_VBP stationed_VBN permanently_RB along_IN the_DT north-east_JJ and_CC north-west_JJ frontiers_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT native_JJ army_NN generally_RB has_VBZ to_TO serve_VB in_IN some_DT stations_NNS of_IN well-known_JJ unhealthiness_NN ,_, in_IN which_WDT the_DT meteorological_NN and_CC other_JJ well-recognized_JJ sanitary_JJ conditions_NNS are_VBP widely_RB different_JJ from_IN what_WP they_PRP are_VBP in_IN Calcutta_NNP ._.
The_DT higher_JJR admission_NN and_CC sick_JJ rate_NN of_IN the_DT native_JJ army_NN is_VBZ probably_RB the_DT result_NN of_IN the_DT order_NN by_IN which_WDT every_DT man_NN unfit_NN for_IN duty_NN is_VBZ shown_VBN as_IN a_DT patient_NN in_IN hospital_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT higher_JJR death-rate_NN in_IN the_DT police_NN force_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN (_( quoting_VBG Dr._NNP Woodford_NNP 's_POS remarks_NNS )_) ``_`` the_DT police_NN chowkeedar_NN 's_POS daily_JJ average_NN of_IN duty_NN being_VBG from_IN 8_CD to_TO 10_CD hours_NNS ,_, he_PRP is_VBZ exposed_VBN to_TO all_PDT the_DT changes_NNS of_IN climate_NN and_CC season_NN ._. ''_''
Perhaps_RB ,_, too_RB ,_, the_DT system_NN of_IN under-feeding_JJ (_( alluded_VBN to_TO in_IN paragraph_JJ 14_CD of_IN this_DT summary_NN )_) ,_, while_IN it_PRP doubtless_VBZ lessens_VBZ the_DT power_NN of_IN resisting_VBG disease_NN ,_, may_MD at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN tend_VB to_TO cause_VB a_DT fatal_JJ termination_NN of_IN many_JJ diseases_NNS whose_WP$ course_NN in_IN more_RBR healthy_JJ subjects_NNS would_MD be_VB towards_JJ recovery_NN ._.

The_DT increase_NN of_IN the_DT in_IN and_CC out-door_JJ patients_NNS from_IN the_DT former_JJ class_NN was_VBD 28_CD and_CC 196_CD respectively_RB ,_, against_IN the_DT figures_NNS of_IN 1875_CD ,_, and_CC the_DT increase_NN of_IN Native_JJ patients_NNS was_VBD 71_CD and_CC 268_CD above_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT same_JJ year_NN ._.
Dr._NNP Bird_NNP remarks_NNS that_IN ``_`` a_DT greater_JJR number_NN of_IN patients_NNS were_VBD treated_VBN during_IN the_DT past_JJ year_NN than_IN in_IN any_DT other_JJ since_IN the_DT foundation_NN of_IN the_DT institution_NN ._.

The_DT resources_NNS at_IN the_DT disposal_NN of_IN the_DT committee_NN are_VBP limited_VBN ,_, so_IN also_RB are_VBP the_DT energies_NNS of_IN the_DT establishment_NN and_CC the_DT space_NN included_VBD in_IN the_DT wards_NNS ._.

The_DT following_VBG table_JJ exhibits_NNS the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN Christian_JJ patients_NNS (_( European_JJ and_CC Eurasian_JJ )_) treated_VBN for_IN certain_JJ diseases_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT mortality_NN and_CC death-rates_NNS from_IN each_DT ._.
For_IN the_DT sake_NN of_IN comparison_NN the_DT corresponding_JJ statistics_NNS of_IN 1875_CD are_VBP also_RB given:36_JJ REPORT_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP Remittent_NNP fever_NN ._.
11_CD ._.
Regarding_VBG the_DT prevalence_NN and_CC severity_NN of_IN cases_NNS of_IN remittent_NN fever_NN ,_, Dr._NNP Bird_NNP writes_VBZ that_IN ``_`` in_IN the_DT past_JJ year_NN the_DT type_NN of_IN remittent_NN ever_RB in_IN Howrah_NNP was_VBD more_RBR virulent_JJ than_IN that_DT which_WDT characterized_VBD the_DT disease_NN in_IN 1875_CD ,_, and_CC the_DT mortality_NN was_VBD larger_JJR in_IN the_DT former_JJ year_NN than_IN in_IN the_DT latter_NN ._.
The_DT same_JJ treatment_NN was_VBD followed_VBN in_IN both_DT years_NNS ._.
This_DT consisted_VBN of_IN the_DT æther_NNP mixture_NN ,_, rum_NN and_CC ammonia_NN ,_, and_CC occasionally_RB Warburgh_NNP 's_POS tincture_NN ._.
The_DT latter-_JJ mentioned_JJ remedy_NN is_VBZ the_DT best_JJS of_IN all_DT ,_, and_CC comes_VBZ very_RB nearly_RB to_TO being_VBG a_DT specific_NN for_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
With_IN abundance_NN of_IN this_DT drug_NN at_IN hand_NN ,_, the_DT medical_JJ man_NN may_MD confidently_RB count_VB on_IN a_DT successful_JJ result_NN in_IN almost_RB every_DT case_NN ,_, provided_VBD the_DT patient_NN comes_VBZ under_IN his_PRP$ care_NN not_RB later_RB than_IN the_DT 7th_JJ day_NN of_IN the_DT fever_NN ._. ''_''
The_DT mortality_NN from_IN remittent_JJ fever_NN during_IN 1876_CD was_VBD at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 210.5_CD per_IN mille_NN of_IN Christians_NNPS and_CC 267.3_CD Natives_NNS ,_, against_IN 68.18_CD and_CC 194.76_CD in_IN 1875_CD ._.
When_WRB the_DT mortality_NN from_IN cholera_NN was_VBD excessive_JJ ,_, that_IN from_IN fever_NN was_VBD moderate_JJ ,_, and_CC vice_NN versâ_NN ._.
12_CD ._.
The_DT figures_NNS in_IN the_DT two_CD preceding_NN tables_NNS reveal_VBP another_DT remarkable_JJ fact_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ that_IN when_WRB the_DT mortality_NN from_IN cholera_NN was_VBD at_IN a_DT high_JJ rate_NN among_IN the_DT Christian_NNP and_CC Native_NNP patients_NNS ,_, that_IN from_IN fever_NN was_VBD moderate_JJ ,_, and_CC vice_NN versâ_NN ._.
This_DT extraordinary_JJ fluctuation_NN in_IN the_DT severity_NN of_IN these_DT two_CD diseases_NNS is_VBZ not_RB easily_RB accounted_VBN for_IN ,_, nor_CC has_VBZ any_DT explanation_NN been_VBN offered_VBN regarding_VBG it_PRP ._.
Dysentery_NNP ._.
13_CD ._.
Dr._NNP Bird_NNP observes_VBZ that_IN ``_`` dysentery_NN was_VBD ,_, on_IN the_DT whole_NN ,_, less_RBR prevalent_NN in_IN 1876_CD than_IN in_IN 1875_CD ,_, but_CC the_DT mortality_NN among_IN the_DT Native_NNP patients_NNS was_VBD excessive_JJ ._.
This_DT was_VBD owing_VBG to_TO many_JJ of_IN the_DT dysenteric_JJ cases_NNS being_VBG received_VBN in_IN a_DT moribund_NN state_NN ._. ''_''
Among_IN the_DT Christian_JJ patients_NNS 38_CD cases_NNS of_IN dysentery_NN were_VBD treated_VBN without_IN the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN a_DT casualty_NN ,_, but_CC among_IN the_DT Native_NNP patients_NNS the_DT mortality_NN from_IN this_DT disease_NN was_VBD at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 382.71_CD per_IN mille_NN of_IN total_JJ treated_VBN ._.
Residences_NNS of_IN cholera_NN patients_NNS ._.
14_CD ._.
In_IN the_DT following_JJ tables_NNS are_VBP shown_VBN the_DT residences_NNS and_CC number_NN of_IN the_DT cholera_NN patients_NNS admitted_VBD into_IN the_DT European_NNP and_CC Native_NNP wards_NNS of_IN the_DT Howrah_NNP General_NNP Hospital_NNP during_IN the_DT ear_JJ 1876_CD :_: CALCUTTA_NNP MEDICAL_NNP INSTITUTIONS_NNP ._.
37_CD the_DT temporary_JJ latrines_NNS and_CC bath-rooms_NNS were_VBD placed_VBN ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN cleaned_VBN ,_, covered_VBN with_IN cement_NN ,_, and_CC made_VBD available_JJ as_IN a_DT promenade_NN for_IN the_DT patients_NNS ,_, while_IN almost_RB the_DT whole_NN of_IN the_DT commodes_NNS formerly_RB in_IN use_NN have_VBP been_VBN discarded_VBN ._.
As_IN a_DT consequence_NN of_IN this_DT ,_, the_DT general_JJ appearance_NN of_IN the_DT wards_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN rendered_VBN much_RB more_RBR tidy_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT atmosphere_RB more_RBR pleasant_JJ and_CC whole-_JJ some_DT ._.
In_IN the_DT new_JJ latrine_NN ,_, the_DT 'dry_JJ earth_NN '_'' is_VBZ in_IN successful_JJ operation_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT year_NN the_DT hospital_NN building_NN and_CC out-houses_NNS were_VBD put_VBN in_IN thorough_JJ repair_NN ._. ''_''
It_PRP is_VBZ very_RB satisfactory_JJ to_TO notice_VB that_IN the_DT bath-rooms_NNS and_CC latrine_JJ arrangements_NNS ,_, which_WDT were_VBD reported_VBN on_IN in_IN preceding_VBG years_NNS as_IN being_VBG ``_`` as_RB objectionable_JJ as_IN can_MD well_RB be_VB imagined_VBN ,_, ''_'' have_VBP been_VBN done_VBN away_RB with_IN ,_, and_CC that_IN the_DT new_JJ and_CC approved_JJ ones_NNS ,_, which_WDT were_VBD under_IN construction_NN ,_, have_VBP been_VBN completed_VBN and_CC brought_VBN into_IN use_NN ._.
Such_JJ an_DT essential_JJ improvement_NN in_IN the_DT sanitary_JJ condition_NN of_IN the_DT hospital_NN will_MD ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB confidently_RB predicted_VBN ,_, add_VB considerably_RB to_TO the_DT comfort_NN of_IN the_DT patients_NNS and_CC will_MD ensure_VB them_PRP a_DT purer_NN atmosphere_RB than_IN they_PRP could_MD have_VB enjoyed_VBN while_IN the_DT bath-rooms_NNS and_CC latrines_NNS existed_VBN in_IN their_PRP$ former_JJ and_CC highly_RB objectionable_JJ positions_NNS with_IN reference_NN to_TO the_DT wards_NNS occupied_VBN by_IN them_PRP ._.

History_NN of_IN the_DT dispensary_NN ._.
THIS_NNP institution_NN was_VBD opened_VBN in_IN 1840_CD ,_, for_IN the_DT treatment_NN of_IN in_IN and_CC out-door_JJ patients_NNS ._.

Medical_JJ officer_NN ._.
2_CD ._.

Building_NN ._.
3_CD ._.

Number_NNP of_IN registered_JJ prostitutes_NNS ._.
2_CD ._.

3_CD ._.

In_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT circumstance_NN that_IN there_EX was_VBD a_DT falling_VBG off_IN of_IN 4,075_CD in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN persons_NNS treated_VBN ,_, the_DT Lieutenant-Governor_NNP can_MD not_RB but_CC consider_VB this_DT increase_NN in_IN expenditure_JJ unsatisfactory_NN ._.

48,000_CD ._.

6,861_CD over_IN the_DT estimate_NN of_IN 1874_CD ._.

Although_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN patients_NNS was_VBD so_RB much_JJ smaller_JJR ,_, there_EX was_VBD actually_RB an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT amount_NN expended_VBD on_IN bazar_NN medicines_NNS ,_, and_CC on_IN wine_NN and_CC spirits_NNS ,_, and_CC a_DT large_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT wages_NNS of_IN servants_NNS ;_: while_IN the_DT decrease_NN in_IN the_DT cost_NN of_IN dieting_VBG the_DT sick_NN does_VBZ not_RB at_IN all_DT correspond_NN with_IN the_DT falling_VBG off_RP in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN patients_NNS ._.
The_DT Lieutenant-Governor_NNP has_VBZ recently_RB found_VBN it_PRP necessary_JJ to_TO appoint_VB a_DT com-_JJ mittee_NN to_TO report_VB on_IN the_DT expenditure_NN of_IN this_DT hospital_NN ._.

The_DT financial_JJ management_NN of_IN the_DT Howrah_NNP Hospital_NNP has_VBZ been_VBN successful_JJ ._.
Though_IN there_EX was_VBD an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN sick_JJ ,_, the_DT (_( 4_CD )_) charges_NNS for_IN dieting_VBG ,_, for_IN medical_JJ comforts_NNS ,_, and_CC for_IN ``_`` miscellaneous_JJ charges_NNS ''_'' show_VBP a_DT decrease_NN ;_: while_IN the_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT gross_JJ expenditure_NN is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO expendi-_JJ ture_NN on_IN repairs_NNS ._.
This_DT hospital_NN receives_VBZ no_DT medicines_NNS free_VBP from_IN Government_NNP ;_: yet_CC its_PRP$ expenditure_NN is_VBZ well_RB within_IN its_PRP$ income_NN ._.
Mr._NNP Eden_NNP has_VBZ very_RB strong_JJ grounds_NNS for_IN believing_VBG that_IN the_DT expenditure_NN on_IN European_JJ medicines_NNS and_CC medical_JJ comforts_NNS in_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT Calcutta_NNP hospitals_NNS is_VBZ excessive_JJ ,_, and_CC that_IN charges_NNS are_VBP thrown_VBN upon_IN Government_NNP which_WDT ,_, by_IN careful_JJ management_NN and_CC a_DT proper_JJ con-_JJ trol_NN of_IN issues_NNS ,_, might_MD be_VB avoided_VBN ._.
7_CD ._.

It_PRP always_RB seems_VBZ to_TO me_PRP that_IN to_TO compare_VB the_DT death_NN rates_NNS of_IN any_DT hospitals_NNS ,_, except_IN military_JJ hospitals_NNS ,_, is_VBZ of_IN very_RB little_JJ use_NN ,_, as_IN the_DT results_NNS are_VBP very_RB misleading_JJ if_IN it_PRP is_VBZ taken_VBN for_IN granted_VBN that_IN he_PRP smallest_JJS mortality_NN indicates_VBZ the_DT most_RBS successful_JJ treatment_NN ._.

It_PRP is_VBZ the_DT same_JJ in_IN every_DT regiment_NN and_CC detachment_NN ;_: but_CC into_IN civil_JJ hospital_NN ,_, patients_NNS ,_, for_IN whom_WP they_PRP are_VBP intended_VBN and_CC who_WP ought_MD to_TO go_VB ,_, are_VBP not_RB compelled_VBN to_TO do_VB so_RB ,_, and_CC too_RB often_RB they_PRP stay_VBP out_RB too_RB long_RB and_CC apply_VB for_IN admission_NN when_WRB treat-_JJ ment_NN is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO be_VB of_IN little_JJ service_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ especially_RB the_DT case_NN in_IN India_NNP ._.

Of_IN 18_CD cases_NNS of_IN typhoid_NN fever_NN ,_, 16_CD were_VBD from_IN the_DT shipping_NN ._.

Many_JJ of_IN the_DT cases_NNS were_VBD of_IN a_DT very_RB severe_JJ type_NN ,_, the_DT sufferers_NNS being_VBG almost_RB moribund_VBN on_IN admission_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT year_NN an_DT operating_NN theatre_NN and_CC a_DT lying-in-room_NN were_VBD added_VBN to_TO the_DT hospital_NN building_NN and_CC both_DT are_VBP now_RB in_IN use_NN ._.
The_DT Lieutenant-Governor_NNP also_RB sanctioned_VBD the_DT erection_NN of_IN new_JJ quarters_NNS for_IN the_DT nurses_NNS and_CC the_DT work_NN was_VBD begun_VBN before_IN the_DT close_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
The_DT department_NN of_IN the_DT Sumbhoonath_NNP Pundit_NNP 's_POS Ward_NNP for_IN out-door_JJ patients_NNS was_VBD abolished_VBN on_IN the_DT 31st_CD December_NNP ,_, and_CC as_IN the_DT cost_NN of_IN the_DT ward_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB out_IN of_IN all_DT proportion_NN to_TO its_PRP$ usefulness_NN ,_, the_DT Lieutenant-Governor_NNP has_VBZ recently_RB ordered_VBN it_PRP to_TO be_VB altogether_RB closed_VBN ._.

(_( 6_CD )_) Howrah_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, and_CC both_DT Dr._NNP Bird_NNP and_CC Dr._NNP Pilcher_NNP consider_VB it_PRP of_IN very_RB great_JJ value_NN ._.

in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN in-door_JJ patients_NNS treated_VBN ._.

7_CD ._.
Dr._NNP Irving_NNP ,_, in_IN referring_VBG to_TO the_DT efforts_NNS that_WDT have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN during_IN the_DT past_JJ year_NN under_IN the_DT Lieutenant-Governor_NNP 's_POS orders_NNS to_TO put_VB some_DT check_NN on_IN the_DT excessive_JJ expenditure_NN of_IN former_JJ years_NNS ,_, has_VBZ thought_VBN proper_IN to_TO designate_VB the_DT year_NN as_IN one_CD of_IN ``_`` rigid_JJ economy_NN ''_'' during_IN which_WDT ``_`` the_DT screw_NN was_VBD continuously_RB applied_VBN for_IN the_DT purpose_NN of_IN reducing_VBG expenditure_NN in_IN all_DT possible_JJ ways_NNS ._. ''_''
Dr._NNP Irving_NNP ,_, however_RB ,_, will_MD no_DT doubt_NN on_IN reflection_NN admit_NN that_IN these_DT loose_JJ and_CC careless_JJ expressions_NNS do_VBP not_RB in_IN any_DT way_NN represent_VBP the_DT real_JJ policy_NN of_IN Government_NNP ,_, which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN repeatedly_RB explained_VBN ._.
The_DT policy_NN of_IN Government_NNP has_VBZ been_VBN to_TO secure_VB to_TO the_DT sick_JJ under_IN treatment_NN proper_JJ food_NN ,_, comforts_NNS ,_, and_CC medicines_NNS ,_, and_CC to_TO check_VB the_DT malpractices_NNS which_WDT are_VBP now_RB admitted_VBN to_TO have_VB existed_VBN by_IN all_DT except_IN those_DT who_WP were_VBD directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT state_NN of_IN things_NNS under_IN which_WDT ,_, while_IN the_DT sick_JJ were_VBD deprived_VBN of_IN the_DT medicines_NNS and_CC comforts_NNS ordered_VBN for_IN them_PRP ,_, the_DT tax-payers_NNS of_IN India_NNP were_VBD defrauded_VBN of_IN large_JJ (_( 4_CD )_) sums_NNS of_IN money_NN ._.
The_DT policy_NN of_IN Government_NNP has_VBZ been_VBN simply_RB and_CC solely_RB directed_VBN against_IN waste_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT results_NNS described_VBD in_IN the_DT report_NN show_VB how_WRB enormous_JJ the_DT waste_NN has_VBZ been_VBN ._.

The_DT Lieutenant-Governor_JJ trusts_NNS that_WDT Dr._NNP Irving_NNP may_MD not_RB have_VB intended_VBN that_IN his_PRP$ words_NNS should_MD convey_VB the_DT meaning_NN which_WDT they_PRP obviously_RB bear_VBP ,_, and_CC this_DT seems_VBZ the_DT more_RBR probable_JJ ,_, because_IN the_DT figures_NNS he_PRP himself_PRP gives_VBZ support_NN inferences_VBZ the_DT very_RB reverse_NN of_IN those_DT which_WDT would_MD be_VB naturally_RB drawn_VBN from_IN his_PRP$ remarks_NNS ._.

;_: in_IN 1876_CD ,_, when_WRB the_DT diet_JJ cost_NN 3_CD annas_NNS 9_CD pies_NNS ,_, the_DT death-rate_NN was_VBD 25_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
;_: while_NN in_IN 1878_CD ,_, when_WRB the_DT diet_NN cost_NN only_RB 2_CD annas_NNS 6_CD pies_NNS ,_, the_DT death-rate_NN was_VBD still_RB 25_CD per_IN cent._NN ,_, notwithstanding_VBG all_PDT the_DT unfavourable_JJ circumstances_NNS of_IN a_DT year_NN of_IN excep-_JJ tionally_RB high_JJ prices_NNS and_CC great_JJ sickness_NN ._.
